revised_title: Development and Anatomy of the Tuatara (Sphenodon punctatum)
tldr: The author examines the development of the Tuatara (Sphenodon punctatum) and provides a detailed summary of the 16 stages of its embryonic development. Key findings include the formation of the amnion, the role of the parietal eye, and the unique features of the Tuatara's anatomy, such as the presence of distinct longitudinal stripes during development.
